page_content:
*Project implementation period:* 01.06.2018. - 31.05.2019 r.
*Priority axis:* III. Higher education for economy and development
*Measure:* 3.3 Internationalization of Polish higher education.
*Total project value:* PLN 34,230.00, *including ESF funding:* PLN 34,230.00.
*Project objectives:*.
The aim of the project is to strengthen the scientific potential of a group of 7 computer science students of the Faculty of Mathematics and Computer Science at the Nicolaus Copernicus University in Toru≈Ñ by preparing and participating in international team programming competitions.
*Planned outcomes (products/results):*.
Number of people covered by the programs to support their participation in international competitions or competitions - 7
*Project description:*.
Within the framework of the project, it is planned for students to participate in international team programming competitions, which will be preceded by the implementation of regular activities consisting in solving programming tasks on their own with the use of a local program testing platform and joint analysis of problems, algorithms and specific implementations prepared by project participants.
As part of the project, students will participate in the following 3 international competitions:
- *Open International Student Olympiad In Programming* (KPI-OPEN).
- *ACM Central Europe Regional Contest 2018* preceded by students' participation in The 2018 Polish Collegiate Programming Contest (AMPPZ).
- *Deadline24*.
*Project Coordinator:* Dr. Marcin Piatkowski.
*Project supervisor at DZFS:* Joanna Staszewska, MA.
room: 113 phone: (0-56) 611-49-84
fax: 611-49-84
e-mail: jstaszewska@umk.pl

--------------------------------------------------

*The project is co-financed by the European Union under the European Social Fund*.

metadata.title: Development of outstanding WMiI UMK computer science students through participation in international programming competitions
